featureType.name: incidents
featureType.title: Incidents
featureType.abstract:
Getting incidents within an area defined by the AREA variable (which should be formatted as BBOX).
In addition, the view supports the following filters (as view parameters): STARTDATE - Start date (YYYY-MM-DD), inclusive ENDDATE - End date (YYYY-MM-DD), inclusive CRIME - Comma separated list of crime types ('type', 'type') NEIGHBOURHOOD - ID of the neighbourhood that the incidents should belong to, if not defined, then incidents are not limited to a single neighbourhood
featureType.nativeCRS: GEOGCS["WGS 84", DATUM["World Geodetic System 1984", SPHEROID["WGS 84", 6378137.0, 298.257223563, AUTHORITY["EPSG","7030"]], AUTHORITY["EPSG","6326"]], PRIMEM["Greenwich", 0.0, AUTHORITY["EPSG","8901"]], UNIT["degree", 0.017453292519943295], AXIS["Geodetic longitude", EAST], AXIS["Geodetic latitude", NORTH], AUTHORITY["EPSG","4326"]]

latLonBoundingBox.crs: GEOGCS["WGS84(DD)", DATUM["WGS84", SPHEROID["WGS84", 6378137.0, 298.257223563]], PRIMEM["Greenwich", 0.0], UNIT["degree", 0.017453292519943295], AXIS["Geodetic longitude", EAST], AXIS["Geodetic latitude", NORTH]]

virtualTable.name: Incidents
virtualTable.sql: SELECT i.gid, i.geom, i.crime, i.force FROM incidents i, neighbourhoods n WHERE ST_Within(i.geom, ST_MakeEnvelope(%AREA%)) AND n.gid = CASE WHEN %NEIGHBOURHOOD% = 0 THEN n.gid ELSE %NEIGHBOURHOOD% END AND ST_Within(i.geom, n.geom) AND i.date BETWEEN '%STARTDATE%' AND '%ENDDATE%' AND crime = ANY(ARRAY[%CRIME%])
